posts.title: Zheng Huangniu and Yushanzhu
posts.medium: Pair of hanging scrolls; ink on paper

tweets.text: Two Chinese sages ride donkeys into Japanese art history. Kano Naizen painted these scrolls when Japan's doors were closing to the world. The irony: celebrating foreign wisdom just as isolation began. Kano Naizen, Zheng Huangniu and Yushanzhu, early 17th century. The Met.

posts.title: Saint Lawrence

tweets.text: Saint Lawrence grips the grill that killed him. This deacon was burned alive in Rome, 258 AD. The martyr's serene expression—carved from lindenwood in 1502—came from an altarpiece destroyed in 1813. Only 4 figures survived. Tilman Riemenschneider, Saint Lawrence, 1502–8. Cleve...
